intro: Neckeria aurea, commonly known as the golden neckeria, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are often tinged with yellow or gold at the edges, giving it its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright red berries. Neckeria aurea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
